---
title: "Mentoring Handbook"
format: docx
editor: visual
---

mentors <- data.frame(
  name = c("Alice", "Bob", "Charlie"),
  occupation = c("Data Scientist", "Software Engineer", "Statistician"),
  interests = c("Machine Learning, Visualization, R", "Web Development, Python, SQL", "Bayesian Inference, Stan, Shiny")
)
 

# loop over the rows of the data frame
for (i in 1:nrow(mentors)) {
  # print a page break
  cat("\\newpage\n")
  
  # print the name of the mentor in bold and large font
  cat(paste0("**# ", mentors$name[i], "**\n\n"))
  
  # print the occupation and interests of the mentor in a table
  knitr::kable(
    mentors[i, c("occupation", "interests")],
    caption = "Mentor Information",
    align = "l"
  )
}
